title: Study on the effect of ceria concentration on the silicon oxide removal rate in chemical mechanical planarization

general_instrumentation.Digital_microscope: Dino lite Edge (AnMo Electronics Corporation, Taiwan)

samples.experiment_context: CMP using commercial colloidal Ceria slurry at 0.5 wt% concentration, adjusted to pH 4, with 4 psi polishing pressure.

particle_size_distribution_smp.observation: Mode peak shift of ~4 nm observed in waste slurry compared to raw slurry, indicating active particles bonded to silicon oxide.

surface_morphology_sem.description: Lowest particle count among Ceria samples

surface_morphology_om.description: Narrowest band-shaped adsorption layer among Ceria samples

samples.experiment_context: CMP using commercial colloidal Ceria slurry at 1.0 wt% concentration, adjusted to pH 4, with 4 psi polishing pressure.

surface_morphology_sem.description: Increased particle count compared to 0.5 wt%

surface_morphology_om.description: Wider band-shaped adsorption layer compared to 0.5 wt%

samples.experiment_context: CMP using commercial colloidal Ceria slurry at 2.0 wt% concentration, adjusted to pH 4, with 4 psi polishing pressure.

surface_morphology_sem.description: Increased particle count compared to 1.0 wt%

surface_morphology_om.description: Wider band-shaped adsorption layer compared to 1.0 wt%

samples.experiment_context: CMP using commercial colloidal Ceria slurry at 4.0 wt% concentration, adjusted to pH 4, with 4 psi polishing pressure.

surface_morphology_sem.description: Highest particle count among Ceria samples

surface_morphology_om.description: Widest band-shaped adsorption layer, most of wafer cloudy

samples.experiment_context: CMP using commercial colloidal Silica slurry at 1 wt% concentration, adjusted to pH 10, with 4 psi polishing pressure.

zeta_potential.source: Text Section 3.3 implies negative zeta potential above pH 3

surface_morphology_sem.description: Lowest particle count among Silica samples

samples.experiment_context: CMP using commercial colloidal Silica slurry at 5 wt% concentration, adjusted to pH 10, with 4 psi polishing pressure.

zeta_potential.source: Text Section 3.3 implies negative zeta potential above pH 3

surface_morphology_sem.description: Increased particle count compared to 1 wt%
